intro: Oenothera strigosa, commonly known as prairie sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. It has hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Oenothera strigosa is often found in prairies, open woodlands, and along roadsides.
